title.narrative: Humanitarian Assistance and Resilience Programme Facility

description.narrative: The majority of the project budget focuses on the implementation of humanitarian programmes. This involves supporting and management of implementing partners. Broadly, this can be divided into three sections: ongoing large grants to INGOs; new calls for proposals for INGOS; and new calls for proposals for national NGOs.

participating-org.narrative: UK - Foreign, Commonwealth and Development Office

activity-date.narrative: Inception phase of the project: includes mobilisation of project team, logistical setup, needs analysis and workplan for Strategic Capacity Building Facility, activities to deliver with each output, initial project logframe and monitoring framework, plan for the Innovation fund and a set of policies and procedures that will ensure the smooth running of the facility. Implementation will begin in January 2017. Existing large grants inherited from DfID will start and the second round of funding calls will also be released. Technical support will commence in the relevant areas.

sector.narrative: Management of the implementation of humanitarian programmes (multi-sector), and direct implementation of technical support and capacity building.
